boat.name: Snoopy
boat.full_description:
Snoopy was originally built in Rotterdam, as lifeboat no 5 for MPV Noordam, 1946-1963 and then Nova Z from 1967-1973.

She was purchased by her current owner and converted for use as a single-handed cruising yacht. She has sailed round Britain clockwise from the Netherlands, through the Scottish canals, with a small extension from Falmouth via the Azores to Kinsale, Ireland. When planning to take part in the OGA Round Britain Challenge, 2013, the skipper decided to sail counter-clockwise, starting from Holland and crossing to Whitby directly, resulting in a trip to Cowes of around 1400 miles before returning to the Netherlands. The log of this passage is on Sailing by.
boat.short_description: Snoopy was converted from a ship's lifeboat by the current owner. He has sailed her single-handed to the Azores and back as well as around Britain from the Netherlands twice.
